metadata.title: CVE-2020-36766 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.8.6.drivers/media/cec/core/cec-api.c leaks one byte of kernel memory onspecific hardware to unprivileged users, because of directly assigninglog_addrs with a hole in the struct.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36766` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-120-generic - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-120-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-120-lowlatency - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-120-generic - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-120-lowlatency - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1085-aws - 4.15.0-1085.90~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1098-azure - 4.15.0-1098.109~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1086-gcp - 4.15.0-1086.98~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1056-oracle - 4.15.0-1056.61~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1085.90~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.109~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1086.98~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
